Girl Develop It Columbus

Community

In addition to classes, we host a variety of meetups, programs, workshops and speakers to talk with and learn from other coders, beginners and experts alike. If you are a possible future student or a professional from the community who wants to help out, you have an open invitation to stop by any event and get to know us better. See our full calendar for upcoming events.

Teachers & Teaching Assistants

We're almost always looking for more good teachers and TAs. We expect our teachers to no only be able to rock the subject matter but be particularly good at presenting it to beginners. If you want to participate in an existing class or have an idea for a future one, fill out our teacher/TA application form.

Speakers & Workshops

We host regular hack nights where coders from the community can get together, work on projects and help each other learn. Often, we have speakers who stop by to present on various topics related to the field. We're also developing a series of workshops to offer instruction on a broader range of languages and applications. If you're interested in leading or contributing, you can use our teacher application form to let us know.

Mentorship program

We're working on putting together a mentorship program to match people in the community who have something specialized to teach or who don't have the time to commit to helping with classes with people who want to learn. It's still in the beginning stages, so if you're interested in helping to build it, send us a message.
